results.title: Kitty and the cartwheelers' shopping jeep bonanza [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Michaela French, Pia Abrahams, Film Victoria. Independent Film-makers' Fund and Teetotum Pictures
results.brief_description: This clever ‘mockumentry’ profiles a large range of shoppers and their affectionate relationship with that all-Australian icon: the shopping jeep. Using the South Melbourne market and Station Pier as a background, director Michaela French reveals the many faces of this Australian icon, from traditional brown vinyl to fully customable vehicle able to accommodate every usage and need, including pet limousine. Features an interview with a jeep manufacturer who enlightens the viewer as to the options available on the market, as well as interviews with jeep owners who describe how they have personalised the handy carrier.
results.title_for_label: Kitty and the cartwheelers’ shopping jeep bonanza [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michaela French, Pia Abrahams, Film Victoria. Independent Film-makers’ Fund and Teetotum Pictures

results.title: Kitty and the bagman
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, Anthony Buckley and Forest Home Films
results.brief_description: A drama about two of Sydney’s best known crime queens - Kitty O’Rourke and Big Lil - who created havoc in the underworld of the 1920’s. Together these two women ran the sly grog shops, gambling houses, prostitution and hold up merchants during the seamier side of 1920’s life in Australia. Stars Liddy Clark and John Stanton.

results.title: Kite flying
results.creator_credit: David Waddington, Australia Council and David Waddington Productions
results.brief_description: Peter Travis sees kite-making as an art form and himself as a sculptor. The complex strings of geometric pieces that he assembles to form his large kites, he calls “flying colourfield geometric constructions”. Travis is shown flying his kites and talking about their making. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Kitchen sink
results.creator_credit: Alison MacLean, Bridget Ikin and Hibiscus Films
results.brief_description: Alison MacLean’s highly acclaimed first film, shot in stark black-and-white, is a wordless experimental horror/romance short about a women who gets much more than she bargains for when she dislodges a rope of hair from the bowels of her kitchen sink. A darkly humorous, tender and disturbing love story about abject female desire that evokes elements of the Frankenstein story. The film competed at Cannes in 1989 and won eight international awards.

results.title: Kitchen come true
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Alvin Armstrong, Betty Brunke and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how an old fashioned farm kitchen may be updated into a modern and convenient 1945 kitchen through careful planning and efficient conversion of existing space and materials. During the planning stage, the following are considered: saving steps in the kitchen; provision of adequate shelf space; facilitating house cleaning; provision of ample laundry space; washing and cleaning area; and a well-lit desk for children’s homework. Shows the planning, design, construction and enjoyment of a new kitchen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ernest Reid, Alvin Armstrong, Betty Brunke and ONF | NFB

results.title: Kitchen and Canteen Safety
results.brief_description: Few other work areas match the kitchen in number and variation of risks and hazards. Hygiene, personal protective equipment, manual handling, use of knives, slips, trips and falls, dealing with kitchen fires and general hazards are all addressed and appropriate action suggested in this program.

results.title: Kiss Me Petruchio (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This is a funny, fast-paced documentary based on the New York Shakespeare Festival’s production of “The Taming of the Shrew”. starring Meryl Streep and Raul Julia. This film goes behind the scenes to find out what makes the 400-year-old play relevant to audiences today. The show features interviews intercut with sections of the play.

results.title: Kiribati? Here we are
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: On 12 July 1979 the Gilbert Islands, in the Central Pacific Ocean, became independent from British rule. The film shows the way of life of the people and includes a brief historical background.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
